content: Is there a way to inspect the application of a tactic? For example if my proof contains "simp", I would like to know which exact lemma was used by simp to resolve the goal, and more generally if the tactic performs several steps I would like to be able to see those steps.
For simp specifically, there is simp? which tells you which lemmas were used.

Generally, you can sometimes use show_term tac to execute tac and show the generated proof term, but for many tactics this is a large incomprehensible mess. (A similar way is to write #print my_lemma after proving my_lemma.)
Another option for simp and a few other tactics is to turn on tracing, e.g. write set_option trace.Meta.Tactic.simp true before your lemma.
Thanks @Floris van Doorn for all the tips, super useful!
Olivier Bousquet has marked this topic as resolved.
